intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri var. variabilis, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It has a compact growth habit with a basal rosette of leaves and stems that rise from the center. The species is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems.
